objects.description: Flash, that is AS3 based projects that I've worked on.  These projects were mostly done during the early stages of my career (2009-2011) before I moved on to other technologies (iOS, Android, Django/Python + Web).
objects.name: Flash

projects.content:
Lab: Particle Text

This is one of my first Action Script experiments. Place your cursor near or in the text and watch the text get repelled away with a blobby particle effect.

Click to Play
projects.title: Lab: Particle Text

projects.content:
Lab: Papervision Field of Vision

When I first started learning AS3 at home I saw this amazing flash 3d demo.  I wanted to do something similar myself as a demo for flash work.  I couldn't write my own 3d engine like the guy who wrote that demo did.  So I used papervision 3d and created my own depth of field filter and created animations to demo it.

The camera for the demo can be controlled with the mouse by clicking and the moving left or right for rotation on the y axis and then up or down to zoom.  In the demo, the camera set to always focus on the purple ball.

Click to Play
projects.title: Lab: Papervision Field of Vision

projects.content:
Ant & Dec's Push the Button

Eleven days, eleven games!

When Ralph offered us the opportunity to work on a project featuring Ben's heroes Ant and Dec we jumped at the chance to help them out. The aim of the Push the Button game is to try and finish as many games as possible within the time limit. Mohu's brief was simple, to make eleven of these mini-game engines in eleven days.

The game is no longer active online, but below are standalone versions of the games that I made. Unfortunately, these will not include instructions or even inform the player once they have won as the specs was that these mini games would delegate all these tasks to a parent via events.

Click to Play

Click to Play

Click to Play

Click to Play

Click to Play

Click to Play

Click to Play
projects.title: Ant & Dec's Push the Button

projects.content:
Audio Agent

This is the flash app used by many estate agents when they want a audio image brochure presentation of their property.  It is skinnable and configured via xml.

Click to View.
projects.title: Audio Agent

projects.content:
Come Fly With Me

We were asked by Ralph to build the flash parts of Little Britain's new TV show ‘Come Fly With Me’.  One of these was an interactive magazine inflight catalogue.

Click to View.
projects.title: Come Fly With Me

projects.content:
Out of Trouble

We were requested by Signal Noise to make a Flash signup app for Out of Trouble to get more people to signup for their cause. They wanted each person who signs up to take away part of an Image of a kid in jail with some extravagent animation.  This will continue until the kid is completely taken out of the picture.  We did finally finish after many animations that did not pass for eitheir looking too much like shooting the kid or blowing him up.

The campaign has finnished so a demo below can be viewed instead.

Click to Play
projects.title: Out of Trouble

projects.content:
Londonewcastle

Londonewcastle is a leading central London residential developer.  A mohu we developed their old flash site, new html site, and sites for their luxury developments.
projects.title: Londonewcastle

projects.content:
Rock 'n Vole

Our brief from Liveline was to design and create a game that would engage, entertain and educate the young audience of the newly launched Wildlife Watch site.

Mohu worked with Liveline to develop the initial game concept, and then took that forward both designing and developing the final game which has been a huge hit with Wildlife Watch members.

We brought in talented illustrator Nuyu to work with on designing the in-game characters and backgrounds. These were then animated and pulled into the bespoke game-engine including a leaderboard, challenge-a-friend system and a level-editor.

Click to View.
projects.title: Rock 'n Vole

projects.content:
The Big Sofa

We are really rather proud of this one. Imagine you are running a business and want to get a feel for who your customers are. What frustrations do they have with your competitors? What really excites them about the kinds of products or services you offer?

The Big Sofa lets lets you see everyday people talking about things they really care about. Use it to research a demographic and find out what twentysomethings think about the big society or search for anything and just see where the buzz is at. Once you have some nice juicy opinions, create some clips and download them to add the weight of real world opinions and character to your presentations.
projects.title: The Big Sofa

projects.title: Triton Building Holding Page

objects.description: Apps I've made for mobile devices.
objects.name: Mobile

projects.content:
CabSmart

Be Safe. Be CabSmart.

Don’t run the risk of using unbooked minicabs. CabSmart is the easy way to find nearby authorised minicab providers in London.

Powered by the same database as TfL’s award-winning ‘CabWise’ service, CabSmart is the sensible choice for booking a licensed minicab operator on your iPhone. Unlike other cab apps we don't use our own database – it's all live up-to-date data from TfL’s database of authorised minicabs, so you can rest assured that your minicab operator has been fully licensed.

Unfortunately, Metro released at the same time an almost identical app, except it was free and had an UK wide database.  With Metro's budget, their app is probably well maintained and by now probably have improved with lots more features now.  So... please dont buy CabSmart.
projects.title: iOS: CabSmart

projects.content:
TypePong

Our first iPhone app has hit the shelves in the form of TypePong.

Built for our friends over at HypeForType, it’s a retro resurgence with a modern twist. Pong is back. But not just any old Pong. Oh no. It’s TypePong my friends. Pong. With type. This time, it’s on the iPhone, and as one of the most addictive games out, we’re sure you’ll have hours and hours of fun.

Unfortunately the game is now offline due to copyright.
projects.title: iOS: TypePong

projects.content:
QA Prince2 Learning Aid App

The most popular PRINCE2 study aid in the app store.  It features hotspotted diagrams with links to a subset of the textbook builtin, checklists, glossary, and a test with question and answers from real exams.

View in iTunes.
projects.title: iOS: QA PRINCE2 Learning Aid

projects.content:
Channel Flip

We made a port of Channel Flips most popular iPhone app for Android: David Mitchell“s Soap Box.  After this we also created “Robert Llewellyn’s: Fully Charged” and “Jon Ronson’s: Escape and Control” for Android.
projects.title: Android: Channel Flip

objects.description: Projects built with a Django backend.
objects.name: Django

projects.content:
Base79 YouTube Portals

Two different sites for showing google analytics data. One targeted at Content Owners and another at Brands.

Content Owners can see how their channels are performing relative to other channel in similar categories and will be advised on where they can improve.

Brands can add brands they want to compare to and compare to other brands of similar categories.

Features:

  • AWS Elastic Beanstalk
  • shared common code base
  • site is broken down into many repositories with features being shared across other applications too
  • integration of YouTube analytics data into our own servers
  • Live aggregation of YouTube analytics apis for unfeasible integrations
  • unit tests and bdd tests
  • Fabric for python tasks
  • Grunt for javascript tasks
  • Sass (Compass), requirejs
  • Backbone (but not a one page app)
projects.title: YouTube Portals

projects.content:
My Portfolio

(Update) Have temporarily cached django backend api results because of cloud sql not being free anymore.

This is this site itself.  It is both my first Backbone & first Google App Engine site.

Features:

  • Backbone, with requireJS and r.js for production optmisation
  • Django backend
  • Google App Engine for free hosting.
  • Google App Engine Blobstore storage for free storage, and easy thumbnail support on GAE (Blobstorage has thumbnail support for images).
  • Memcache
  • Sass
  • Suzy grids for sass to seperate positional and dimensional styles out of html files.  Bootstrap grid style spanxx classes encourages placing these styles in both html layouts and css files.  This is bad encapsulation.  It also eases fluid design if there are no size or positional styles in the html layout.
projects.title: My Portfolio

projects.content:
Brandopus Corporate

Brand Opus is one of the fastest growing FMCG Design agencies. Listed in the design Week top 10 packaging agencies as well as the top 100 youngest agencies, with a who's who list of clients and several awards adorning their mantle piece.

The Brand Opus website serves as a platform for them to showcase their work, at the same time reflecting their creative thinking. By creating a CMS for Brand Opus, we allowed them to easily update both the site and their blog whilst incorporating custom parallax scrolling effects that can be controlled through the admin section.
projects.title: Brandopus Corporate

projects.content:
Brandopus Share

This is Brandopus's own branded file sharing (mini drop box / send big file like) web app.

Features include:

  • secure files accessable by authorized users only
  • files can also be sent to non members with expiry dates
  • file previews
  • integration with brandopus blogs, tweets, and press releases
  • skinnable look and messages for different clients
  • user and group level file sharing permissions
  • email notifications
  • one page web application for responsiveness.
projects.title: Brandopus Share

projects.content:
Brandopus Signoff Tool

This web application is integrated with brandopus's share site and is used for the artwork design and signoff process.

This application features:

  • commentable amends
  • markable previews
  • downlodable annotated pdfs of artwork and comments at its different stages
  • batch download of artworks.
  • user roles with different tasks and reponsibilties
  • email notifications for all stages and rounds.
  • one page web application for responsiveness.
projects.title: Brandopus Signoff Tool

projects.content:
City & Docklands

We produced an industry first app for the team at City and Docklands to help them track purchases of apartments in real-time happening at multiple property exhibitions around the world. This essentially eradicated the scenario where different negotiators in different locations could inadvertently sell the same apartment to different customers.

Some features include:

  • small iPad App for negotiators and Big Screen App to inform all clients of updates
  • iPad brochure
  • computerised reservation system.
  • live notification to all iPad Apps of reservation and sales
  • admin with live reports
  • admin can apply discount to specific users live
  • one page web application for responsiveness.
projects.title: City & Docklands

projects.content:

Working closely with Life Residential this Global multilingual site delivers on all levels.
